docs.snippet: This CBS series pushes artificial intelligence and crime-fighting elements hard as it begins its fifth and final season....
docs.lead_paragraph: This CBS series pushes artificial intelligence and crime-fighting elements hard as it begins its fifth and final season.
docs.abstract: Mike Hale Critic's Notebook discusses fifth and final season of CBS series Person of Interest, concluding its appeal is balance of humor and action similar to many genre and comic book-based shows.

headline.main: ‘Person of Interest,’ Its Computers and Crime, Returns
headline.print_headline: Hackers and Tensions Return for a Final Run

docs.snippet: A federal judge on Tuesday sentenced a Hawaii mother to a month in jail and three months under home confinement for assaulting her 15-month-old daughter on a flight from Alaska....
docs.lead_paragraph: A federal judge on Tuesday sentenced a Hawaii mother to a month in jail and three months under home confinement for assaulting her 15-month-old daughter on a flight from Alaska.

headline.main: Mom Gets 1 Month in Jail for Assaulting Toddler on Plane
headline.print_headline: Mom Gets 1 Month in Jail for Assaulting Toddler on Plane

docs.snippet: Facebook Inc's Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg called on Brazilians to demand his company's WhatsApp messaging service  never be blocked again after an appeals court on Tuesday overturned the application's second suspension in five months....
docs.lead_paragraph: Facebook Inc's Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg called on Brazilians to demand his company's WhatsApp messaging service  never be blocked again after an appeals court on Tuesday overturned the application's second suspension in five months.

headline.main: Facebook CEO Urges Brazilians to Decry WhatsApp Block
headline.print_headline: Facebook CEO Urges Brazilians to Decry WhatsApp Block

docs.snippet: The nation’s most populous state has almost always been an afterthought in the primaries, but this year’s Republican contest promises to change that....
docs.lead_paragraph: The nation’s most populous state has almost always been an afterthought in the primaries, but this year’s Republican contest promises to change that.
docs.abstract: Republican presidential candidates campaign intensely in California, which will hold its first meaningful Republican primary since 1964; excitement over opportunity to decisively influence nomination is tempered by worry that candidates' extreme positions and bitter rhetoric will harm efforts to overhaul party's image in state.

headline.main: California Prepares for Long-Denied Star Turn in Presidential Race
headline.print_headline: California Republicans Prepare for a Long-Denied Star Turn

byline.original: By ADAM NAGOURNEY and JONATHAN MARTIN

docs.snippet: Can a single word ever encompass the experience of sexual violence?...
docs.lead_paragraph: Can a single word ever encompass the experience of sexual violence?
docs.abstract: Parul Sehgal First Words column examines word 'survivor' as it applies to those who have experienced sexual violence.
